DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether chronic hepatic insufficiency is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to chronic hepatic insufficiency.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Hepatic insufficiency resulting in clinical jaundice and/or coagulation defects

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients not tolerating immune-mediated hepatitis due to compromised hepatic reserve, including: patients with extensive liver metastasis (as judged by the investigator), patients who drink more than two standard alcoholic beverages per day on a regular basis, and patients who consume more than 2 grams of Acetaminophen per day on a regular basis

ReferenceDocuments.name: GI_CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Hepatic insufficiency resulting in clinical jaundice,encephalopathy and/or variceal bleed within 60 days prior to study entry

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Severe hepatic disease,defined as a diagnosis of Child-Pugh Class B or C hepatic disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text#7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Hepatic insufficiency resulting in clinical jaundice, encephalopathy and/or variceal bleed at the time of study entry.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinically apparent jaundice and/or coagulation defects

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-2 2179984v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator   - dbw
